trans-unit.source: DirectX Game Development | Visual Studio
trans-unit.target: DirectX Game Development | Visual Studio

trans-unit.source: Write, build, and debug your DirectX games in Visual Studio. Get started quickly with a robust set of DirectX game development tools.
trans-unit.target: Write, build, and debug your DirectX games in Visual Studio. Get started quickly with a robust set of DirectX game development tools.

trans-unit.source: DirectX Game Development
trans-unit.target: DirectX Game Development

trans-unit.target: DirectX Gaming | Visual Studio

trans-unit.target: DirectX Game Development

trans-unit.target: Tab Down to Select a Version of Visual Studio

trans-unit.source: Write, build, and debug your DirectX games in Visual Studio.
trans-unit.target: Write, build, and debug your DirectX games in Visual Studio.

trans-unit.source: Project templates
trans-unit.target: Project templates

trans-unit.source: Get started quickly
trans-unit.target: Get started quickly

trans-unit.source: Learn more
trans-unit.target: Learn more

trans-unit.source: <span>Get started building DirectX games in Visual Studio by using the built-in DirectX project templates.
trans-unit.target: <span>Get started building DirectX games in Visual Studio by using the built-in DirectX project templates.

trans-unit.source: Whether you’re building a DirectX 12 or DirectX 11 game for Windows or Windows Phone, you’ll find a template that suits you.
trans-unit.target: Whether you’re building a DirectX 12 or DirectX 11 game for Windows or Windows Phone, you’ll find a template that suits you.

trans-unit.source: Debug graphics
trans-unit.target: Debug graphics

trans-unit.source: Capture frames local or remote
trans-unit.target: Capture frames local or remote

trans-unit.source: Learn more
trans-unit.target: Learn more

trans-unit.source: <span>Rendering problems can be tricky to troubleshoot.
trans-unit.target: <span>Rendering problems can be tricky to troubleshoot.

trans-unit.source: Visual Studio Graphics Diagnostics provides an easy way to capture and analyze frames from your DirectX 10, 11, or 12 games locally or remotely.
trans-unit.target: Visual Studio Graphics Diagnostics provides an easy way to capture and analyze frames from your DirectX 10, 11, or 12 games locally or remotely.

trans-unit.source: You can inspect each DirectX event, graphics object, pixel history, and look into the graphics pipeline to understand exactly what occurred during the frame.
trans-unit.target: You can inspect each DirectX event, graphics object, pixel history, and look into the graphics pipeline to understand exactly what occurred during the frame.

trans-unit.source: This tool also captures call stacks for each graphics event, making it easy to navigate back to your application code in Visual Studio.
trans-unit.target: This tool also captures call stacks for each graphics event, making it easy to navigate back to your application code in Visual Studio.

trans-unit.source: Debug shader code
trans-unit.target: Debug shader code

trans-unit.source: The same world-class debugger now works for your shader code
trans-unit.target: The same world-class debugger now works for your shader code

trans-unit.source: Learn more
trans-unit.target: Learn more

trans-unit.source: <span>Debugging shader code from a captured frame is another great way to pinpoint the source of rendering problems. Simply set a breakpoint in your shader code and press F5 to debug it.
trans-unit.target: <span>Debugging shader code from a captured frame is another great way to pinpoint the source of rendering problems. Simply set a breakpoint in your shader code and press F5 to debug it.

trans-unit.source: You can inspect variables and expressions in Locals and Autos.
trans-unit.target: You can inspect variables and expressions in Locals and Autos.

trans-unit.source: If you’ve used the Visual Studio debugger for other languages before, you’ll find yourself right at home.
trans-unit.target: If you’ve used the Visual Studio debugger for other languages before, you’ll find yourself right at home.

trans-unit.source: Increase frame rate
trans-unit.target: Increase frame rate

trans-unit.source: Find expensive draw calls
trans-unit.target: Find expensive draw calls

trans-unit.source: Learn more
trans-unit.target: Learn more

trans-unit.source: <span>Looking for ways to increase the frame rate for your game?
trans-unit.target: <span>Looking for ways to increase the frame rate for your game?

trans-unit.source: Visual Studio Frame Analysis can come in handy.
trans-unit.target: Visual Studio Frame Analysis can come in handy.

trans-unit.source: It analyzes captured frames to look for expensive draw calls and performs experiments on them to explore performance optimization opportunities – all in a nice report.
trans-unit.target: It analyzes captured frames to look for expensive draw calls and performs experiments on them to explore performance optimization opportunities – all in a nice report.

trans-unit.source: Analyze GPU usage
trans-unit.target: Analyze GPU usage

trans-unit.source: Understand how your game is performing on the CPU and the GPU
trans-unit.target: Understand how your game is performing on the CPU and the GPU

trans-unit.source: Learn more
trans-unit.target: Learn more

trans-unit.source: <span>Use Visual Studio GPU Usage to understand how your game performs on the CPU and the GPU.
trans-unit.target: <span>Use Visual Studio GPU Usage to understand how your game performs on the CPU and the GPU.

trans-unit.source: GPU Usage collects data in real time and it complements Frame Analysis, which is performed on captured frames in an offline fashion.
trans-unit.target: GPU Usage collects data in real time and it complements Frame Analysis, which is performed on captured frames in an offline fashion.

trans-unit.source: The GPU Usage report will clearly show where the bottleneck is, whether it’s on the CPU or the GPU.
trans-unit.target: The GPU Usage report will clearly show where the bottleneck is, whether it’s on the CPU or the GPU.

trans-unit.source: Shader code editor
trans-unit.target: Shader code editor

trans-unit.source: Shader syntax colorization
trans-unit.target: Shader syntax colorization

trans-unit.source: Learn more
trans-unit.target: Learn more

trans-unit.source: <span>Whether your shader code is in HLSL files or FX files, the Visual Studio shader editor recognizes them.
trans-unit.target: <span>Whether your shader code is in HLSL files or FX files, the Visual Studio shader editor recognizes them.

trans-unit.source: The shader editor provides syntax highlighting and braces auto-completion, making it easy to read and write shader code in Visual Studio.
trans-unit.target: The shader editor provides syntax highlighting and braces auto-completion, making it easy to read and write shader code in Visual Studio.

trans-unit.source: You can also configure the editor to use your favorite fonts and theme.
trans-unit.target: You can also configure the editor to use your favorite fonts and theme.

trans-unit.source: Compile shader code
trans-unit.target: Compile shader code

trans-unit.source: Shader files are part of your project
trans-unit.target: Shader files are part of your project

trans-unit.source: Learn more
trans-unit.target: Learn more

trans-unit.source: <span>Just like they should be, shader files can be managed and built as part of your Visual Studio projects.
trans-unit.target: <span>Just like they should be, shader files can be managed and built as part of your Visual Studio projects.

trans-unit.source: Simply set the shader file properties to specify the shader type, shader model, and optimization settings you want.
trans-unit.target: Simply set the shader file properties to specify the shader type, shader model, and optimization settings you want.

trans-unit.source: Visual Studio takes care of shader compilation for you.
trans-unit.target: Visual Studio takes care of shader compilation for you.

trans-unit.source: Design pixel shaders
trans-unit.target: Design pixel shaders

trans-unit.source: …in Visual Studio Shader Designer
trans-unit.target: …in Visual Studio Shader Designer

trans-unit.source: Learn more
trans-unit.target: Learn more

trans-unit.source: <span>If you don’t know HLSL or prefer a more visual way to create shaders, the Visual Studio Shader designer has you covered.
trans-unit.target: <span>If you don’t know HLSL or prefer a more visual way to create shaders, the Visual Studio Shader designer has you covered.

trans-unit.source: Instead of writing shader code in an editor, you add and connect shader nodes using a graphical interface.
trans-unit.target: Instead of writing shader code in an editor, you add and connect shader nodes using a graphical interface.

trans-unit.source: You can apply different textures, lights, and even add and view animations in real time.
trans-unit.target: You can apply different textures, lights, and even add and view animations in real time.

trans-unit.source: Making shaders has never been easier.
trans-unit.target: Making shaders has never been easier.

trans-unit.source: View 3D models
trans-unit.target: View 3D models

trans-unit.source: …in Visual Studio Model Viewer
trans-unit.target: …in Visual Studio Model Viewer

trans-unit.source: Learn more
trans-unit.target: Learn more

trans-unit.source: <span>No need to leave the IDE you’re already working in just to view the latest 3D model that your artist sent you.
trans-unit.target: <span>No need to leave the IDE you’re already working in just to view the latest 3D model that your artist sent you.

trans-unit.source: You can view OBJ, FBX 3D models inside Visual Studio.
trans-unit.target: You can view OBJ, FBX 3D models inside Visual Studio.

trans-unit.source: Pan, zoom, change camera positions, view the objects with time-based animations – there’s so much to explore in the 3D world.
trans-unit.target: Pan, zoom, change camera positions, view the objects with time-based animations – there’s so much to explore in the 3D world.

trans-unit.source: You can also make simple edits to the models in the Model Viewer.
trans-unit.target: You can also make simple edits to the models in the Model Viewer.

trans-unit.source: Edit textures
trans-unit.target: Edit textures

trans-unit.source: …in Visual Studio Image Editor
trans-unit.target: …in Visual Studio Image Editor

trans-unit.source: Learn more
trans-unit.target: Learn more

trans-unit.source: <span>The Visual Studio Image Editor not only works great with image files, but also understands DirectDraw Surface (DDS) texture files.
trans-unit.target: <span>The Visual Studio Image Editor not only works great with image files, but also understands DirectDraw Surface (DDS) texture files.

trans-unit.source: Besides the basic viewing and drawing functionality, you can also toggle RGBA channels, generate mip-maps, and apply filters.
trans-unit.target: Besides the basic viewing and drawing functionality, you can also toggle RGBA channels, generate mip-maps, and apply filters.

trans-unit.source: This image editor is capable of accomplishing many texture editing tasks.
trans-unit.target: This image editor is capable of accomplishing many texture editing tasks.

trans-unit.source: Asset content pipeline
trans-unit.target: Asset content pipeline

trans-unit.source: Manage content pipelines
trans-unit.target: Manage content pipelines

trans-unit.source: Learn more
trans-unit.target: Learn more

trans-unit.source: <span>Dealing with assets in various formats can be overwhelming.
trans-unit.target: <span>Dealing with assets in various formats can be overwhelming.

trans-unit.source: Visual Studio provides content pipeline management for images, models, and shaders.
trans-unit.target: Visual Studio provides content pipeline management for images, models, and shaders.

trans-unit.source: Simply set the file properties to use the content pipeline and configure the settings.
trans-unit.target: Simply set the file properties to use the content pipeline and configure the settings.

trans-unit.source: Visual Studio will perform the format conversions for you at build time.
trans-unit.target: Visual Studio will perform the format conversions for you at build time.
